SEARCH
Package com.app.processing.impl

Class DataProcessingImpl

java.lang.Object
com.app.processing.impl.DataProcessingImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataProcessing
public class DataProcessingImpl extends Object implements DataProcessing
The DataProcessing class provides methods for managing and processing data associated with users. It supports adding, removing, and updating user-data associations, as well as performing various operations on the data such as counting pattern occurrences and saving files.

    • DataProcessingImpl

      public DataProcessingImpl()

  • Method Details

    • addUser

      public void addUser(User user, DataImpl dataImpl)
      Adds a user and their associated data to the data process map. Throws an exception if the user or data is null, or if the user already exists in the map.
      Specified by:
      addUser in interface DataProcessing
      Parameters:
      user - the user to be added
      dataImpl - the data associated with the user

    • removeUser

      public void removeUser(User user)
      Removes a user and their associated data from the data process map. Throws an exception if the user is null or if the user does not exist in the map.
      Specified by:
      removeUser in interface DataProcessing
      Parameters:
      user - the user to be removed

    • updateData

      public void updateData(User user, DataImpl dataImpl)
      Updates the data associated with an existing user. Throws an exception if the user or data is null, if the user does not exist in the map, or if the data is to be updated for a non-existing user.
      Specified by:
      updateData in interface DataProcessing
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose data is to be updated
      dataImpl - the new data to associate with the user

    • getPatternOccurrences

      public long getPatternOccurrences(User user, String regex)
      Counts the occurrences of a pattern in the data associated with a specific user. Throws an exception if the user is null, if the regex is null or empty, or if the user does not exist.
      Specified by:
      getPatternOccurrences in interface DataProcessing
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose data is to be processed
      regex - the regular expression pattern to count occurrences of
      Returns:
      the number of occurrences of the pattern in the user's data

    • getPatternOccurrences

      public long getPatternOccurrences(User user, String regex, Filename filename)
      Counts the occurrences of a pattern in a specific file's data associated with a user. Throws an exception if the user, regex, or filename is null, if the regex is empty, if the user does not exist, or if the file does not exist for the user.
      Specified by:
      getPatternOccurrences in interface DataProcessing
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose data is to be processed
      regex - the regular expression pattern to count occurrences of
      filename - the filename whose data is to be processed
      Returns:
      the number of occurrences of the pattern in the file's data

    • modifyData

      public void modifyData(User user, Filename fileName, String newContent)
      Modifies the content of a file associated with a user. Throws an exception if the user, filename, or new content is null or empty, if the user does not exist, if the file does not exist, or if the user is not an administrator.
      Specified by:
      modifyData in interface DataProcessing
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose file is to be modified
      fileName - the filename of the file to be modified
      newContent - the new content to set in the file

    • saveFile

      public void saveFile(User user, Filename filename, Save<String> save)
      Saves the content of a file associated with a user using the provided Save strategy. Throws an exception if the user, filename, or save strategy is null, if the user does not exist, or if the user is not an administrator.
      Specified by:
      saveFile in interface DataProcessing
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose file is to be saved
      filename - the filename of the file to be saved
      save - the Save strategy to use for saving the file
